Vulnerability.Title: grubby bug fix update
Vulnerability.Description: The grubby packages provide grubby, a command-line utility for displaying and editing Grand Unified Bootloader (GRUB) configuration files. This update fixes the following bugs: The grubby utility incorrectly treated certain GRUB2 configuration commands with the quoting rules of another command, and then reassembled the result with an incorrect procedure. This also happened in reverse. The quotes were then used incorrectly and some assignment lines had duplicated parts. The grubby parser has been modified to handle these items separately, and duplicated sections of assignment lines are no longer generated. (BZ#1152550) The grubby(8) manual page now contains previously missing information about the configuration file of the zipl bootloader. (BZ#1158904) The grubby utility did not handle the extlinux configuration files correctly, which caused grubby to fail. This bug has been fixed, and grubby no longer fails in the described situation. (BZ#1200045) Users of grubby are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix these bugs. Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
